intro: Vaccinium caesium, commonly known as sheep laurel, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the northern regions of the Americas and Eurasia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like blueberries and heathers. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of bell-shaped white or pale pink flowers. It produces small, bright red berries that are edible but have a sharp, acidic flavor. Vaccinium caesium is often found in acidic soils and thrives in moist, shaded environments.
